articles.title: Greetings to Chadian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Chadian President
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Idriss Deby, President of the Republic of Chad, on the 49th anniversary of its independence.
					Kim in the message wished the President and people of Chad successes in their efforts for peace, stability and development of the country.

articles.title: Extravaganza "Arirang" Startsã€€
articles.content:
Extravaganza "Arirang" Starts
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" for this year started at the May Day Stadium Monday.
					 The creating staff and performers succeeded in re-representing the extravaganza in a brief span of time; they newly created Scene I of Act III and enriched it with fresh contents more truthfully representing the great mental power and skills of the Korean people and the appearance of the country that has undergone tremendous changes.
					
					 Among the audience were servicepersons and people from all walks of life, diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here, foreign guests and overseas Koreans.
					
					 The performers made an impressive grand epic representation of Juche Korea that has risen high as a dignified sovereign power after putting an end to the history of the nation's sufferings under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and the unshakable faith and will of the army and people of the DPRK to build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation guaranteeing the eternal prosperity of the nation under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The performance was highly acclaimed by the audience for presenting fantastic scenery with a good combination of dynamic mass gymnastics and graceful artistry, ever-changing peculiar background scenes, stage decor and a variety of electronic displays.

articles.title: Cuban Diplomats Tour Wonsan
articles.content:
Cuban Diplomats Tour Wonsan
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Enrique Montoto Cruz, Cuban charge d'affaires a. i. here and his embassy officials visited various parts of Wonsan City on Aug. 10 and 11 on the occasion of the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
					 The guests visited Wonsan University of Agriculture associated with the inerasable footprints of President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and Anti-Japanese Heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 Being briefed on the shining course covered by the university, they went round the room devoted to its history and its soil-using pollution free greenhouse.
					
					 They also visited the Songdowon International Children's Camp and other places in the city.

articles.title: Taehongdan Flourishing with Potato Farming
articles.content:
Taehongdan Flourishing with Potato Farming
Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Taehongdan in the northeastern area of Ryanggang Province in the northern inland of Korea is well-known as the place thriving with potato farming today.
					 It was once a barren land unfit for habitation where dire poverty had prevailed for many years. But today its looks have changed beyond recognition.
					
					 There are in Taehongdan well-furnished potato research institute, potato processing factory, pig farms, beautiful sea of potatoflowers, comprehensive mechanization of farming work, well-off living and wonderful bright lights in the evening. All these are features to be seen only in the county today.
					
					 All the farming--ploughing, sowing and spraying of agricultural chemicals-- is done by machines.
					
					 The county harvests scores of tons of potatoes per hectare every year and lorries carry the potatoes in time.
					
					 The potato processing factory processes yielded potatoes within two months.
					
					 The factory produces various processed potato products including starch, starch syrup, behydrated starch noodle and liquor to supply the county inhabitants every month.
					
					 Taehongdan is crowded with officials coming to learn potato farming experience, people calling on relatives, those coming to create literary and fine art pieces about the graceful sea of potatoflowers and the bright lights in the evening.

articles.title: White Pine-nut Tree Propagated in North Hwanghae Province
articles.content:
White Pine-nut Tree Propagated in North Hwanghae Province
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- White pine-nut tree which was found in Rinsan County, North Hwanghae Province, DPRK for the first time has been propagated in cities and counties of the province.
					 The tree, which is regarded as a special mutation phenomenon in the vegetable kingdom, is a new species of oil-bearing tree native to Korea. 
					
					 It bears white seed. Its nutshell is thinner, flesh is 1.25 times and output is 1.5 times compared with other pine-nut seeds.
					
					 The ordinary pine-nut trees bear fruits 15 years after transplantation, but the white pine-nut tree produces a result in six or seven years.
					
					 Rinsan County has conducted research into extensive propagation of the white pine-nut tree of high-yield variety in cooperation with the Research Institute of Economic Value Forest under the State Academy of Sciences, thus registering many successes.
					
					In 2008 and 2009 alone, lots of white pine-nut trees were planted in Sohung, Phyongsan, Yonthan, Pongsan, Unpha, Hwangju, Suan and other counties.
					
					 Having set a goal to plant the white pine-nut trees in all mountains in the province, North Hwanghae Province is directing efforts to manure and tend white pine-nut trees.

articles.title: Korean Ancestors' Efforts to Increase Naval Force
articles.content:
Korean Ancestors' Efforts to Increase Naval Force
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Korean nation has put emphasis on increasing naval force from olden times as the country is bounded by seas on three sides.
					 According to a historic record, King Jun of the Ancient Korea (the early 30th century B.C. to 108 B.C.) was toppled by a coup in the early 2nd century B.C. and fled away by ship along with his party and thousands of subjects. It proves that there existed a fleet of large ships in the kingdom.
					
					 The navy came to have basic appearance as a regular naval force in the years of Koguryo (277 B.C. to 668 A.D.) In 396 the Koguryo navy carried out a large-scale maritime expedition, rare to be seen at that time, for territorial integration. And in the early 5th century it attacked enemy's den making a long detour by sea. The Koguryo navy, with control of the sea, victoriously conducted landing and coast defense operations as well as sea battles and expeditions.
					
					 In the early 8th century the Palhae navy, with secret maritime maneuver and surprise landing, attacked and captured a naval base of invaders in a twinkle, striking terror into the enemies' hearts. Palhae had a developed shipbuilding industry and made many big ships capable of carrying a large number of personnel and munitions. In 731 the Palhae navy beat back 300 warships of Japanese aggressors, who intruded into the East Sea of Korea, in alliance with the latter Silla which controlled the area of south of the River Taedong.
					
					 The warships of Koryo (918 to 1392) were very stout and swift.
					
					 The invention and production of cannon by Choe Mu Son in the closing years of Koryo promoted qualitative strengthening of the naval force.
					
					 The Koryo people built gunboats with water-proof and air-tight magazines for the first time in the world. Since then the hand-to-hand fight on ship gradually gave its place to firing battle.
					
					 The powerful warships of Koryo armed with guns for the first time in the world burnt down all the Japanese aggressors' warships totaling more than 500 in the sea off Jinpho in 1380.
					
					In the period of Ri Dynasty (1392 to 1910) the navy was further strengthened. Historical records say that the kingdom had 829 warships of 13 kinds and over 50,000 seamen in the first half of the 15th century.
					
					 What was most famous at that time was the world's first iron-clad warship, the tortoise warship. The stout and swift warship with peculiar shape, simple structure and excellent fire equipment was incomparably powerful. The warship displayed its might to the full during the Imjin Patriotic War.

articles.title: Japanese PM's Reckless Remarks Blasted
articles.content:
Japanese PM's Reckless Remarks Blasted 
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Japanese Prime Minister Aso was reported to have uttered at a recent Japan-south Korea summit that "Japanese public would be increasingly vocal for the nuclear weaponization if the nuclear issue of north Korea festers."
					 Commenting on this, news analysts of papers Tuesday observe: Aso talked about the need for Japan to go nuclear at an official summit not out of his concern for the settlement of the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun says:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' talk about "concern about the national security" under the pretence of the non-existent "threat" from some one is nothing but a ploy to make the nonsensical theory of "chain reaction" to nuclear weaponization sound plausible in a bid to secure a pretext for going nuclear. 
					
					 These days the U.S. is busy spreading the rumor among world public that failure to check the DPRK's nuclear weaponization would spark a "chain reaction" in Japan and south Korea. What matters is that Aso echoed this as if he had been waiting for it to happen. 
					
					 There is no need for Japan to worry about its security as long as it is assured of the U.S. provision of "its nuclear umbrella." 
					
					 If Japan has access to nukes, it will upset the nuclear equilibrium which has been preserved in Northeast Asia with much effort.
					
					 Should Japan calculate it can legally push forward the nuclear weaponization under the pretext of the hypocritical theory of "chain reaction" to the nuclear weaponization, citing someone's access to nukes, it is a shortsighted way of thinking and a historical blunder. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries had better drop their absurd scenario to pave the way for going nuclear under the pretence of the DPRK's access to nukes for self-defence and realize their old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere".
					
					 Minju Joson says that the Japanese reactionaries openly disclosed their wrong view that it is necessary for Japan to have access to nukes. This suggests that they are keen to use the "nuclear domino theory" which had already proved bankrupt as it lost its practical value and significance long ago.

articles.title: Retraction of U.S.-S. Korea Military Exercises Urged
articles.content:
Retraction of U.S.-S. Korea Military Exercises Urged
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- It is a reckless and sheer sophistry distorting the reality for the U.S. and its followers to pull up the DPRK over its nuclear test for peaceful purpose, and this will only result in aggravating the situation of the Korean Peninsula.
					 Miroslav Stepan, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, said this on August 5 when meeting with the DPRK ambassador to the Czech Republic.
					
					 He demanded that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities retract at once their projected Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises for aggression on the DPRK.
					
					 The Czechoslovak Communist Party extends full support and solidarity to the Korean people's just cause, he said.

articles.title: Police's Suppression of Unionists' Strike Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Police's Suppression of Unionists' Strike Flailed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-National Alliance for Korea's Reunification issued a statement on August 7 denouncing the south Korean puppet police for taking a repressive measure against the unionists of Ssangyong Motor Co. who staged a strike in demand of the guarantee of the right to existence. 
					 The statement accused the police authorities of arresting on charges of committing crimes 458 persons including unionists of the above-said company when they were coming out of it at the end of the strike and media persons who were covering their action. 
					
					 How can the action staged by the unionists in protest against the management side's step to deprive them of their right to existence be branded as a crime? the statement queried, noting that the Lee Myung Bak regime and the management side were to blame for the crisis of Ssangyong Motor Co. as they were keen to destroy the trade union by pursuing a reckless economic policy to meet their interests only. 
					
					 Strongly demanding the authorities not punish the protesters but let them reunite with their families at once, the statement called upon people of all strata in south Korea to turn out in the actions to force the Lee Myung Bak regime to step down as it has driven the people's livelihood to destitution and workers to death.
					
					 Meanwhile, civic and public organizations including the Solidarity for Progress of south Korea, the Citizen's Solidarity for Democratic Society and the Joint Conference of Human Rights Organizations held a press conference in Seoul to urge the police authorities to retract the repressive measure.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported
Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Sweden-Korea Friendship Association issued a statement on August 4 to mark the 12th anniversary of the publication of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					 Kim Jong Il in the work formulated the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, put forth by President Kim Il Sung, as the three charters for Korea's reunification and clarified in detail the basic principle and target for the reunification and the way for its realization, the statement noted, terming the work a great document which indicated the way for achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country by the concerted efforts of the Korean people.
					
					 It stressed that he overcame difficulties with his Songun politics while leading the Korean people's "Arduous March" and the forced march and increased the national defence capability to protect the sovereignty and peace of the country. 
					
					 He wisely led the struggle to frustrate the moves of the anti-reunification forces and provide the inter-Korean dialogue and cooperation on the principle of national independence, it said, adding:
					
					 Today the inter-Korean relations have become tense again and the suppression of the pro-reunification patriotic forces is being intensified in south Korea. The world public opinion should be vigilant against such developments and extend full support and encouragement to the Korean people in the struggle to realize the independent and peaceful reunification of the country by the Korean nation itself.

articles.title: Revolutionary Should Be Broad-minded
articles.content:
Revolutionary Should Be Broad-minded
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- It was when the 70-day campaign was launched in Juche 63 (1974).
					 At a night General Secretary Kim Jong Il set forth a bold goal of the 70-day campaign. Foreseeing that the cargo shipment would increase, he instructed an official by phone that he should take measures for it beforehand.
					
					 He asked him how many derrick cranes for port could be made. Saying that 10 derrick cranes were too small to do work, he stressed that about 50 derrick cranes should be manufactured in a month at any cost.
					
					 Surprised by the exorbitant figure, the official did not speak for a moment with the handset in his hand.
					
					 After fathoming his mind, the leader said to the following effect: I thought you are a man with grit as you are an official of working class background but you seem to be not that kind of people. A revolutionary should be broad-minded. Only then, can he go through difficulties without hesitation to make a breakthrough and vigorously advance no matter what difficult work the Party and the revolution may be faced with.
					
					 He encouraged the official to carry out the task in a bold way as he would positively back it, saying that the mental preparation was important in any work.
					
					 Under the bold and energetic leadership of Kim Jong Il about 50 derrick cranes were installed in major ports in east and west seas of the country in a month.

articles.title: Iniciada la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang"
articles.content:
Iniciada la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang"
Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ATCC) -- Debuto para este ano el dia 10 en el capitalino Estadio Primero de Mayo la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang".
					  El colectivo de creacion y los ejecutantes crearon de nuevo la primera escena del tercer acto y representaron magnificamente en corto tiempo la obra reflejando los contenidos que pueden mostrar bien la alta potencia espiritual y el talento del pueblo coreano y maravillosos aspectos de la patria que se desarrolla.
					
					  La presenciaron los militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea, los trabajadores de distintos estratos, los representantes diplomaticos y representantes de las organizaciones internacionales, acreditados en Corea, los huespedes extranjeros y los coreanos en ultramar.
					
					  Los ejecutantes demostraron con cuadros epicos el aspecto majestuoso de la Corea del Juche que bajo la sabia direccion del Presidente Kim Il Sung, puso fin a la historia de martirios sufridos por la nacion y se convirtio en la potencia independiente con alta dignidad, la firme conviccion y voluntad del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea dispuestos de construir una gran potencia prospera socialista que garantiza la eterna prosperidad de la nacion bajo la guia del Songun (priorizacion militar) del Dirigente         Kim Jong Il.
					
					  La funcion se granjeo efusivos aplausos de los espectadores por la gimnasia masiva animada y vigorosa, la elegante descripcion artistica, la banda de singular pizarra humana, la decoracion escenica, el uso de varias luces electricas, etc.

articles.title: Miembros de embajada cubana visitan varios lugares de Wonsan
articles.content:
Miembros de embajada cubana visitan varios lugares de Wonsan
Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ATCC) -- Con motivo del mes de solidaridad con el pueblo cubano el encargado de negocios a.i. de la Republica de Cuba, Enrique Montoto Cruz, y otros miembros de la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea visitaron los dias 10 y 11 varios lugares de la ciudad de Wonsan.
					Los huespedes estuvieron en la Universidad de Agricultura de Wonsan donde estan impregnadas las inmortales huellas del Presidente Kim Il Sung, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il y la heroina de la lucha antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk.
					
					Ellos recorrieron la sala de presentacion del historial, el invernadero libre de contaminacion del tipo de suelo y otros lugares escuchando la explicacion sobre la orgullosa trayectoria del plantel docente.
					
					Los huespedes cubanos recorrieron tambien el Campamento Internacional de Ninos de Songdowon y otros lugares.

articles.title: En Pyongyang presidenta del Grupo Hyundai
articles.content:
En Pyongyang presidenta del Grupo Hyundai
Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ATCC) -- La presidenta del Grupo Hyundai del Sur de Corea, Hyon Jong Un, y su comitiva llegaron el dia 10 a esta capital via Kaesong cumplimentando la invitacion del Comite Coreano por la Paz de Asia y el Pacifico (CCPAP).
					El vicepresidente del CCPAP, Ri Jong Hyok, y otros funcionarios acogieron a los visitantes.

articles.title: Periodicos condenan a Aso que aboga por el armamentismo nuclear
articles.content:
Periodicos condenan a Aso que aboga por el armamentismo nuclear
 Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ATCC) -- En la reciente "cumbre" Japon-Sur de Corea, el premier japones, Aso, dijo que "si se agrava el problema nuclear del Norte de Corea, se alzarian en el ambito nacional las voces en demanda del armamentismo nuclear".
					  Los periodicos capitalinos publicaron este martes sendos comentarios individuales revelando que Aso dijo ese disparate no porque esta interesado en la solucion del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  Los reaccionarios japoneses hablan tanto de la "preocupacion de la seguridad estatal" pretextando la ficticia "amenaza" de alguien, comienza el diario Rodong Sinmun y prosigue:
					
					De esta manera, ellos tratan de procurar el pretexto de armamento nuclear dando "razon" a la absurda teoria de la "reaccion en cadena" en la posesion de armas nucleares.
					
					  Lo problematico del caso es que Aso se hace eco del rumor difundido por Estados Unidos en los paises circunvecinos, segun el cual se produciria una "reaccion en cadena" en Japon y el Sur de Corea si no se logra impedir la posesion de armas nucleares por la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					  Dado que EE.UU. ofrece el "paraguas nuclear" a Japon, este no tiene porque de preocuparse de su seguridad.
					
					  Si Japon llega a armarse con esos artefactos, se romperia el equilibrio nuclear que iba a establecerse a duras penas en el Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					  Si el cree que podria impulsar legitimamente el armamentismo nuclear aprovechando la absurda teoria de la "reaccion en cadena" a consecuencia de la posesion de armas nucleares de alguien, estaria pensando como falto de vision y cometiendo un error historico.
					
					  Les convendria a los reaccionarios japoneses abandonar su absurdo intento de realizar su anejado sueno con la "Esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia Oriental" emprendiendo el camino de armamentismo nuclear bajo el pretexto de la posesion de armas nucleares por la RPDC para la autodefensa.   
					
					  El periodico Minju Joson revela que los reaccionarios japoneses insisten abiertamente en la necesidad de poseer las armas nucleares sacando de nuevo la "teoria de efecto domino" en la posesion de estos artefactos, que perdio hace mucho tiempo su valor real y sentido, para utilizarla como pretexto de su armamentismo nuclear.
